datanetwork
Class PingResponder

java.lang.Object
  datanetwork.PingResponder

public class PingResponder
extends java.lang.Object

Keeps the connection of the client to the server alive by responding to the server's ping messages. As soon as the client registers, the server sends periodic "ping" messages to the client. The client must respond with a "pong" message otherwise after a certain delay set on the server, the client will be dropped

Part of Sense/Stage

OSC classes are based on Java OSC. Copyright (c) 2002-2006, C. Ramakrishnan / Illposed Software

Version:
001
Author:
Vincent de Belleval
See Also:
OSCListener, OSCPortIn, OSCPortOut, DNConnection

public PingResponder(OSCPortIn in,
                     OSCPortOut out)
Constructs a PingResponder capable of listening on the client's incoming port as well as to send on its outgoing port.

Parameters:
in - the DNConnection OSCPortin.
out - the DNConnection OSCPortOut.
Method Detail

acceptMessage

public void acceptMessage(OSCMessage message)
Recieves OSCMessages from the listeners on OSCPortIn. This method is inherited from the OSCListener interface. As soon as the message's address is "/ping" it sends a messge to the server with the "/pong" reply.

Parameters:
message - the recieved OSCMessage.

removePingResponder

public void removePingResponder()
Removes the PingResponder from the OSCPortIn listeners. Called when DNConnection.unregister() is called.
